title: Graph BFS Traversal (Adjacency List)
prompt:
Given a graph as an adjacency list and a starting vertex, return the values visited by a breadth-first search.

Traversal rules:
- Visit neighbors in the order they appear in the adjacency list.
- Do not visit a vertex more than once.

Return an array of visited vertices in order.
constraintQuestions: Is the graph undirected or directed? (Undirected in examples.)
Should we start from the given vertex? (Yes.)
Should we visit neighbors in adjacency list order? (Yes.)
Do we need to avoid revisiting vertices? (Yes.)
Is the graph always connected? (No, visit only reachable nodes.)

walkthrough.title: Queue-based BFS
walkthrough.body:
Initialize a queue with the start node and a visited set.
Pop from the queue, record the node, then enqueue unvisited neighbors in order.
Continue until the queue is empty.

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (BFS implementation)
Complexity
walkthrough.body:
Time: O(V + E) for vertices and edges.
Space: O(V) for the queue and visited set.
